Premise: A tragic event sends a New York advertising executive on a downward spiral into other events in depression, hope, romantic tendencies and tragedy.
production_company: New Line Cinema Village Roadshow Pictures PalmStar Media Likely Story
Production: On May 13, 2015, it was announced that Hugh Jackman and Rooney Mara would star in the New York-set indie drama Collateral Beauty, to be directed by Alfonso Gomez-Rejon and scripted by Allan Loeb.[1] Michael Sugar and Bard Dorros would produce through their Anonymous Content banner.[1] On June 9, 2015, PalmStar Media's Kevin Frakes came on board to produce and fully finance the film, and Likely Story also on board to co-produce the film, while Loeb would also produce.[2] On June 15, 2015, Variety reported that Jason Segel was in talks to join the film.[3] On July 15, 2015, it was announced that Jackman had exited the project due to his commitment with 20th Century Fox's Wolverine 3 film and producers were eyeing Johnny Depp to start negotiations.[4] On August 4, 2015, Will Smith was added to the cast to play the lead replacing Jackman, while Smith's Overbrook Entertainment would also produce the film.[5] On September 8, 2015, it was announced that New Line Cinema came on board to handle worldwide distribution rights to the film, while Mara had left the project, news confirmed.[6] On October 5, 2015, director Gomez-Rejon exited the film due to creative differences with the studio.[7] On November 8, 2015, it was announced that David Frankel was nearing a deal to direct the film.[8] On December 1, 2015, Variety reported that Helen Mirren was in early talks to join the film, with filming expected to begin early 2016 in New York City.[9] On January 14, 2016, TheWrap reported that Edward Norton, Michael Peña, and Naomie Harris were cast in the film, while Rachel McAdams was in negotiations to join the cast.[10] Village Roadshow Pictures would be co-financing the film.[11] On February 9, 2016, Keira Knightley joined the film and following her Kate Winslet was also cast in the film on the next day.[12][13] Enrique Murciano was spotted filming along with Winslet, while Jacob Latimore also joined the film.[14][15] On March 10, 2016, Ann Dowd signed on to star in the film.[16]Principal photography on the film began on February 22, 2016 in New York City,[17] where the filming also took place in Queens.[18] Actors also spotted filming in Manhattan.[19] On March 10, 2016, filming took place at the Whitney Museum of American Art.[20]
produced_by: Anthony Bregman|Bard Dorros|Kevin Scott Frakes|Allan Loeb|Michael Sugar|
starring: Will Smith|Kate Winslet|Keira Knightley|Helen Mirren|Edward Norton|Michael Peña|Naomie Harris|
Release: Collateral Beauty will be released by Warner Bros. on December 16, 2016 alongside Rogue One: A Star Wars Story.[11]
